DOC.brief_title: Technology Intensified Diabetes Education Study African Americans
DOC.detailed_description: African Americans ( AA ) type 2 diabetes ( T2DM ) high prevalence diabetes , poor metabolic control ( i.e . poorer blood glucose , blood pressure , lipid control ) , great risk complication death compare White Americans . Hemoglobin A1c ( HbA1c ) primary marker glycemic control strong independent predictor development complication increase mortality T2DM . Key self-care behavior influence glycemic control ( HbA1c ) include diet , physical activity , self-monitoring blood glucose medication adherence . Systematic review multiple randomized clinical trial ( RCTs ) show self-care intervention include diabetes education skill train effective improve metabolic control diabetes . Recent finding indicate patient diabetes , especially ethnic minority patient , prefer telephone-delivered diabetes education group visit internet-based education . Multiple RCTs document effectiveness telephone-delivered self-care intervention T2DM . Preliminary data group also suggest culturally-tailored telephone-delivered diabetes education skill train intervention effective strategy improve metabolic control AA patient T2DM . This study provide unique opportunity address gap literature test efficacy technology-intensified diabetes education/skills train ( TIDES ) intervention AAs poorly control T2DM . The long-term goal project identify effective strategy improve metabolic control hence reduce diabetes complication mortality rate AAs T2DM .
